visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a chart with the following specifications: Chart type: column, Chart title: Monthly Sales Data, Axes and labels styling: Use a dark background with light text, font size for labels and titles should be 14px, Data series: Two series - 'Sales' with data [29.9, 71.5, 106.4, 129.2, 144.0, 176.0, 135.6, 148.5, 216.4, 194.1, 95.6, 54.4] and 'Expenses' with data [148.5, 216.4, 194.1, 95.6, 54.4, 29.9, 71.5, 106.4, 129.2, 144.0, 176.0, 135.6], Custom colors: Use a gradient for the 'Sales' series and a solid color for the 'Expenses' series, Additional configurations: Set chart margins to 50px, enable legend, and add a background color to the chart.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a column chart titled 'Monthly Sales Data'. The chart features a dark background with light text styling for labels and titles, ensuring readability. The x-axis represents the months from January to December, while the y-axis represents the amount in a monetary unit. The chart includes two data series: 'Sales' and 'Expenses'. The 'Sales' series uses a gradient color from blue to a darker blue, while the 'Expenses' series uses a solid red color. The chart also includes a legend to differentiate between the two series. Additional configurations include setting the chart margins to 50px on all sides and enabling the legend for better user interaction.
